content:
• Thursday, October 25, 2012
  • P

    Pandora (P -11.7%) rises 3.7% AH after music execs tell CNET Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) Internet...

    Pandora (P -11.7%) rises 3.7% AH after music execs tell CNET Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) Internet radio service is far from a done deal. Though requesting more flexibility for its service than what Pandora and others can offer, Apple reportedly is pushing for a lower royalty rate, and some think its offered cut on iAd sales isn't high enough. However, studios are said to be worried a spurned Apple could join Pandora in supporting the Internet Radio Fairness Act. (Bloomberg report) (more on Apple)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:29 PM | 7 Comments
  • INFA

    Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) guides on its Q3 call for Q4 revenue of $210M-$225M and EPS of...

    Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) guides on its Q3 call for Q4 revenue of $210M-$225M and EPS of $0.35-$0.39 vs. a consensus of $218.4M and $0.39. That's going over well in the wake of the data warehousing software vendor's Q3 warning. Informatica declined to offer a 2013 forecast in light of near-term sales and macro issues. Shares +8% AH.

Shares +5.4% AH. Cloud ERP peer Workday (NYSE:WDAY) could rally in sympathy tomorrow - both companies fell today as part of a general selloff in enterprise tech names.

    More on Amazon: Q4 revenue guidance is below a $22.8B consensus. Q4 operating income (inc. stock...

    More on Amazon: Q4 revenue guidance is below a $22.8B consensus. Q4 operating income (inc. stock compensation) expected to be anywhere from -$490M to +$310M vs. +$260M in year-ago period. North American revenue +33% Y/Y (includes web services), international only +20% (would be +27% if not for forex). Media sales +11%, other merchandise +36%. Headcount rose by 12.3K Q/Q to 81.4K, fulfillment expenses +36% Y/Y, technology/content expenses +55%. AMZN now -2.7% AH. (PR)

    Transdigm Group (TDG +2.5%) agrees to acquire Goodrich's pump and engine control systems...

    Transdigm Group (TDG +2.5%) agrees to acquire Goodrich's pump and engine control systems business from United Technologies (UTX -0.7%) for ~$236M. The business expects ~$195M in 2012 revenues with EBITDA in the low teens as a percent of revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • P

    Pandora (P -14.1%) has resumed trading in an ugly fashion following a report Apple (AAPL -1.5%)...

    Pandora (P -14.1%) has resumed trading in an ugly fashion following a report Apple (AAPL -1.5%) plans to launch an Internet radio service in calendar Q1 2013 - shares were crushed in September after the WSJ first reported on Apple's plans  Bloomberg claims Apple, which sees the service as a way to boost iAd, is negotiating revenue-sharing terms with studios. The fact Apple's service is only expected to work with Apple hardware could limit Pandora's losses, as could the time invested by Pandora users in building custom stations. (more)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • COP

    ConocoPhillips (COP +1.6%) CEO Ryan Lance says during his conference call that he expects total...

    ConocoPhillips (COP +1.6%) CEO Ryan Lance says during his conference call that he expects total capital spending of $15.5B-$16B this year vs. $16B he forecast at the end of Q2. Lance sees Eagle Ford production to peak at 100K boe/day in Q4; this quarter, Eagle Ford peaked at 86K, a company record, and averaged 76K. (Q3 earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • SIRI

    Sirius XM Radio (SIRI -3.1%) spikes lower with news out Apple will enter its space with an...

    Sirius XM Radio (SIRI -3.1%) spikes lower with news out Apple will enter its space with an Internet radio servive. The company that will soon be pulling the reins with Sirius, Liberty Media (LMCA -1%), is also tilting lower.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM | 29 Comments
  • TMO

    Thermo Fisher (TMO +2%) moves up again today on the back of yesterday's strong Q3 results. Baird...

    Thermo Fisher (TMO +2%) moves up again today on the back of yesterday's strong Q3 results. Baird raises its price target on the shares to $70 from $67, citing strong cash flow and robust organic growth. Jefferies also reiterates a Buy , saying its core operating fundamentals are sound, and the better-than-expected numbers point to a continued upward trajectory for the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 1 Comment

    Shares of Pandora (P -9.2%) spike lower before being halted off a Bloomberg headline saying...

    Shares of Pandora (P -9.2%) spike lower before being halted off a Bloomberg headline saying Apple plans to launch an Internet radio service.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM | 9 Comments
  • GDI

    Trading in Gardner Denver (GDI +14.3%) resumes after a brief halt caused by a volatility spike...

    Trading in Gardner Denver (GDI +14.3%) resumes after a brief halt caused by a volatility spike in reaction to reports GDI has asked Goldman Sachs to explore a sale of the company. Blackstone, Bain Capital, KKR, TPG Capital and Onex reportedly are among firms considering offers for the maker of compressors and vacuum products for industrial applications.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • LPHI

    Life Partners (LPHI +4.8%) appoints Colette Pieper as Chief Financial Officer. Before joining...

    Life Partners (LPHI +4.8%) appoints Colette Pieper as Chief Financial Officer. Before joining Life Partners, Pieper served as Accounting Financial Director for San Antonio-based insurance and financial services provider USAA. She is expected to join the company on November 19.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • UAA

    Shares of Under Armour (UA -6.7%) slump after the company beats profit estimates with its Q3...

    Shares of Under Armour (UA -6.7%) slump after the company beats profit estimates with its Q3 report. The company showed broad Y/Y sales gains - 22% in clothing and 21% in footwear - but execs issued guidance that tipped to the cautious side on an earnings conference call (webcast).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • AAPL

    Investors seem nervous ahead of Apple's (AAPL -1%) FQ4 report. Not only is Apple trading lower,...

    Investors seem nervous ahead of Apple's (AAPL -1%) FQ4 report. Not only is Apple trading lower, so are component suppliers Cirrus Logic (CRUS -4%), OmniVision (OVTI -2.2%), Broadcom (BRCM -2%), and SanDisk (SNDK -1.7%). Expectations definitely aren't where they were on Sep. 21, the day the iPhone 5 launched and Apple made its all-time high. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 20 Comments
  • ENTR

    Entropic (ENTR -11.7%) is starting at big losses following its Q3 report. The results weren't...

    Entropic (ENTR -11.7%) is starting at big losses following its Q3 report. The results weren't bad, but the chipmaker guided on its earnings call for Q4 revenue of $89M-$92M and EPS of $0.08, below a consensus of $92.8M and $0.09. Entropic, which is digesting Trident Microsystems' set-top box chip unit, also warned its gross margin could slip thanks to a mix shift towards set-top box SoCs relative to home networking chips.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • ZAGG

    Shares of Zagg (ZAGG +3.2%) move higher with Apple's FQ4 earnings report slated to be released...

    Shares of Zagg (ZAGG +3.2%) move higher with Apple's FQ4 earnings report slated to be released after the market closes. The more iPods, iPhones, and iPads that Apple sells, the larger Zagg's target audience will become.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • BHP

    BHP Billiton (BHP +1.6%) says it expects to file all necessary regulatory documents by the end...

    BHP Billiton (BHP +1.6%) says it expects to file all necessary regulatory documents by the end of 2014 to develop a new harbor at its Western Australian iron ore operations, though it will prioritize other iron ore-related projects. CEO Marius Kloppers declines to comment on a report it intends to sell its Pinto Valley copper mine in Arizona.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • TEX

    Construction machinery maker Terex (TEX -5.3%) gets hit after beating on its Q3 EPS report but...

    Construction machinery maker Terex (TEX -5.3%) gets hit after beating on its Q3 EPS report but coming up short on revenue earlier this morning. Profit declined 18% Y/Y as sales weakened in its construction and cranes segments. CEO Ron DeFeo notes that macroeconomic events have created near-term softening of demand and uncertainty in many of its business segments. As a result, the company now expects full-year revenue to come in at the low end of its guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • CRM

    It's been a rough week for enterprise IT stocks. Many sold off yesterday following EMC and...

    It's been a rough week for enterprise IT stocks. Many sold off yesterday following EMC and Juniper's reports, and a number are pressured today thanks to disappointing results and/or guidance from F5, Fusion-io, ServiceNow, and Citrix. Cloud software, big data, and networking plays are among the losers: CRM -2.1%. WDAY -5%. N -2.2%. SPLK -4.1%. RVBD -4%. PANW -2.6%. ARUN -5.2%. NTGR -2.6%. TIBX -2.8%. QLIK -3.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • AVT

    Avnet (AVT +2.6%) trades up today on a better-than-expected bottom line FQ2 report and raised...

    Avnet (AVT +2.6%) trades up today on a better-than-expected bottom line FQ2 report and raised FQ1 guidance. Total revenue declined 7% Y/Y however, as the company experienced weaker than expected transaction activity towards the end of September as some customers opted to delay certain IT projects. The revenue shortfall was most pronounced in it Americas segment where organic growth declined approximately 18% Y/Y. For FQ2, the company now expects to earn between $0.79 and $0.89 per share, above Street estimates of $0.74.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • CLF

    Weak pricing and higher costs were a disastrous Q3 combo for Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF...

    Weak pricing and higher costs were a disastrous Q3 combo for Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -9.4%): Cash costs in CLF’s Canadian division rose 21% Y/Y to $106.06/ton, while the price of seaborne iron ore fell 36% to an average $112/metric ton vs. $176. CLF says key Q4 goals include continued expansion of the Bloom Lake mine and maintaining the dividend through this business cycle.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM | 6 Comments
  • CTXS

    Citrix (CTXS -2.7%) is selling off after delivering a mixed Q3 report. The thin...

    Citrix (CTXS -2.7%) is selling off after delivering a mixed Q3 report. The thin client/virtualization software provider guided for Q4 revenue of $700M-$710M and EPS of $0.83-$0.85 vs. a consensus of $715.4M and $0.84. Preliminary 2013 guidance is for a 14% revenue gain (roughly in-line). Deferred revenue rose $20M Q/Q to $1.05B. During its earnings call, Citrix claimed macro issues caused "an unusually large number of opportunities" to be pushed out or split up, with the issues "most pronounced in North America during September."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • XSPA

    Volatile Vringo (VRNG +9.7%) is jumping as its trial with Google continues. Yesterday, jurors...

    Volatile Vringo (VRNG +9.7%) is jumping as its trial with Google continues. Yesterday, jurors were asked to discard (at Vringo's request) cross-examination testimony from a Vringo witness regarding a patent licensing deal between Disney and Google. In a "mid-trial report" offered yesterday evening, SA's Steve Kim argued Vringo has established a prima facie case for infringement, following the testimony of a liability expert, while cautioning Google is set to bring out its own experts.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 11 Comments
  • OI

    Owens-Illinois (OI +3.3%) moves up in spite of posting a mixed Q3 report yesterday. The company...

    Owens-Illinois (OI +3.3%) moves up in spite of posting a mixed Q3 report yesterday. The company beat on a per share basis, but came up shy on revenue. Net earnings fell 23% Y/Y as the bottle maker suffered from sluggish beer consumption in the U.S. and Europe, while its bottom line was negatively impacted by rising raw-materials, energy and transportation costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • QRVO

    TriQuint (TQNT -11.2%) plummets following its Q3 report. Though results beat estimates and Q4...

    TriQuint (TQNT -11.2%) plummets following its Q3 report. Though results beat estimates and Q4 revenue guidance of $220M-$225M is largely above a $220.3M consensus, EPS guidance of $0.01-$0.03 is below a $0.06 consensus. TriQuint, which has a power amplifier module designed into the iPhone 5, claims inventory cuts will hurt its Q4 gross margin. But it's worth noting other Apple suppliers have seen margin pressure to due to Apple's manufacturing/pricing demands. Cantor notes TriQuint continues to bleed RF component share.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • OSTK

    Overstock.com (OSTK +16.3%) takes off after reporting Q3 revenue of $255.4M (+7% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    Overstock.com (OSTK +16.3%) takes off after reporting Q3 revenue of $255.4M (+7% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.11 - the one analyst following the online retailer had estimated revenue of $253.8M and EPS of -$0.10. Overstock, which has been bleeding share to Amazon, saw its bottom line benefit from Y/Y declines of 6% and 10%, respectively, in technology and G&A expenses. Gross margin was up 20 bps Q/Q and 220 bps Y/Y to 18.2%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP -6.4%) has had a roller-coaster ride over the last two days. Shares took off...

    Yelp (YELP -6.4%) has had a roller-coaster ride over the last two days. Shares took off yesterday following the Qype acquisition and Facebook's Q3 numbers, but are doing the opposite today. Patent troll Blue Calypso announced it's suing Yelp today, but Yelp is just one of many targets. Possible reasons for volatility: short interest is heavy, a handful of insiders (eligible to sell) own the bulk of outstanding shares, and Q3 results arrive on Nov. 1.
